page.title: 10LEISURE IN FORTHAMPTON
page.content: Leisure is not a major aspect of the conversation of the people in the Forthampton area. This could reflect the age structure of the population with an emphasis towards older people. Facilties are very limited locally although there is a small caravan site at Lower Lode, the old fording point of the River Severn. There is also a public house and a cafe here as well as mooring for a few motor boats. It is a popular spot for people from Tewkesbury to walk to but has a general air of decay about it. There is a working men's club and a youth club in Forthampton plus a thriving Women's Institute. Each year the youth club holds The Forthampton Fun Run during October attracting some 150 runners for the 5 mile event, and the Court holds an annual fete during August.
